		if points[0][0] == points[1][0]:

			slope = (points[1][1] - points[0][1]) / (points[1][0] - points[0][0])
			# Calculate the y-intercept of the line passing through the midpoints
			intercept = points[0][1] - slope * points[0][0]
			# Calculate the coordinates of point A

			# Calculate the coordinates of point D

        center_y = (points[0][1] + points[1][1]) / 2

				D = (midpoint_ac[0] - diagonal_ac / 2, midpoint_ac[1] + diagonal_ac / 2)

		return [tuple(map(int, A)), tuple(map(int, B)), tuple(map(int, C)), tuple(map(int, D))]

        # The y coordinates of A and D are py - (L/2) and qy - (L/2) respectively
        # The x coordinates of B and C are px + (L/2) and qx + (L/2) respectively
        # The y coordinates of B and C are py + (L/2) and qy + (L/2) respectively

        C = [int(px + L/2), int(py + L/2)]
        D = [int(px - L/2), int(py + L/2)]

        points.sort(key=lambda x: (x[0], x[1]))

        dy = qy - (qx - px) / 2

        # Return the corner points in sorted order
